episode_body:
On March 27, 2025 at 08:22 AM, Jessa Galosmo emailed Justin Chumbley regarding "Progressive Claim #25-615241502":

Case: Jessica-Mahaney-MVA-03-09-2025
Client: Jessica Mahaney
__Fwd: Progressive Claim #25-615241502__
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Katie Mills
To: JESSA@WHALEYLAWFIRM.COM ,
aries@whaleylawfirm.com
Hello,
You were both listed as contacts in our claim. Please let me know if I
should only reach out to one of you going forward. We received your letter
of representation for Jessica Mahaney and Dustin Meade. I will be handling
the Personal Injury Protection (PIP) claim being presented on behalf of
your client.* Per your letter, $4,000 of benefits have been reserved, and
we will not pay ER/EMS bills at this time. *I have attached our letter of
Acknowledgment. I have also attached a blank PIP Application, dec page, and
policy.
If able, please respond to my initial treatment and injury questions:
1. Have either of your client treated anywhere else in addition to Scott
County Chiro?
2. Did your client lose any wages? If so, please advise where they work,
what their job is, what their pay rate is and how long they may be off
work. (We'll need off work slips and wage documentation from the employer)
Thank you for your time.
*Katie Mills**|**KY Medical Claims Representative*
PO Box 2930 | Clinton, IA 52733
Phone 502-909-3687 | Fax 877-213-7258
Hours: Monday-Friday 8:00 am-5:00 pm EST
Email: Katherine_e_mills@progressive.com
The contents of this e-mail and any attachments are confidential and may be
legally privileged, intended solely for the addressee. If you are not the
intended recipient, be advised that any use, dissemination, distribution,
storage (including electronic) or copying of this e-mail is strictly
prohibited. If you receive this e-mail in error, please notify the sender
immediately by reply e-mail and destroy the message and its attachments.
--
All the best,
Jessa Galosmo
Whaley Law Firm

episode_body:
On July 08, 2025 at 12:03 PM, Justin emailed Jessicamahaneymvaz4957022 regarding "RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Progressive Claim #25-615241502":

Case: Jessica-Mahaney-MVA-03-09-2025
Client: Jessica Mahaney
__FW: [EXTERNAL] RE: Progressive Claim #25-615241502__
-----Original Message-----
From: Katie Mills
To: Jessa Galosmo
Cc: justin@whaleylawfirm.com
Jessa & Justin,
I'm following up on the PIP claim for Dustin Meade and Jessica Mahaney. Their most up to date PIP logs are attached. At this stage in the claim, we are nearing 16 weeks of treatment since their accident. This is typically the mark when we may need to send a maximum medical improvement form to be completed by their provider, so we can appropriately document our claim. Please provide a treatment status update when you are able. Are either of them seeing a new provider? Do you know their current treatment plans?
Dustin initially reported lost wages to me. He advised that he missed 8 hours per day on 3/10 & 3/11. These dates have been paid. Do you know if he missed additional time?
I received a pip app from Jessica prior to her representation, which is attached. It looks like her hourly wage would be $17.50 per hour, but she reported returning to work on 3/17. Her off work note lists 3/27 as the return date. Can you please respond to the questions below?
-Where does Jessica work? What is her job title?
-Please provide a good contact for her supervisor. I need to send a wage verification form to them for dates missed beyond the first week (3/15).
-Is $17.50 an accurate hourly wage for her?
-Was she out of work the full time from 3/9-3/27?
-I also need to get a little more information included on the off-work note. We don't have medical records prior to 3/20. Can we get a note with a start and end date, and a little more info included as why she had to remain out for that amount of time?
If that hourly wage is correct for her, I can get that first week paid while we wait for the wage verification form and off work note to come in.
Please let me know if you have any questions.
Katie Mills|KY Medical Claims Representative PO Box 2930 | Clinton, IA 52733 Phone 502-909-3687 | Fax 877-213-7258
Hours: Monday-Friday 8:00 am-5:00 pm EST
Email: Katherine_e_mills@progressive.com
The contents of this e-mail and any attachments are confidential and may be legally privileged, intended solely for the addressee. If you are not the intended recipient, be advised that any use, dissemination, distribution, storage (including electronic) or copying of this e-mail is strictly prohibited. If you receive this e-mail in error, please notify the sender immediately by reply e-mail and destroy the message and its attachments.
-----Original Message-----
From: Katie Mills
To: Jessa Galosmo
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Progressive Claim #25-615241502
Hi Jessa,
I'm following up on the PIP claim for Dustin Meade and Jessica Mahaney. Their most up to date PIP logs are attached.
Dustin initially reported lost wages to me. He advised that he missed 8 hours per day on 3/10 & 3/11. These dates have been paid. Do you know if he missed additional time?
I received a pip app from Jessica prior to her representation, which is attached. It looks like her hourly wage would be $17.50 per hour, but she reported returning to work on 3/17. Her off work note lists 3/27 as the return date. Can you please respond to the questions below?
-Where does Jessica work? What is her job title?
-Please provide a good contact for her supervisor. I need to send a wage verification form to them for dates missed beyond the first week (3/15).
-Is $17.50 an accurate hourly wage for her?
-Was she out of work the full time from 3/9-3/27?
-I also need to get a little more information included on the off-work note. We don't have medical records prior to 3/20. Can we get a note with a start and end date, and a little more info included as why she had to remain out for that amount of time?
As long as that hourly wage for her, I can get that first week paid while we wait for the wage verification form and off work note to come in.
Please let me know if you have any questions.
Katie Mills|KY Medical Claims Representative PO Box 2930 | Clinton, IA 52733 Phone 502-909-3687 | Fax 877-213-7258

Email: Katherine_e_mills@progressive.com

-----Original Message-----
From: Katie Mills
To: justin@whaleylawfirm.com
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Progressive Claim #25-615241502
Hi Justin,
I'm just following up on this. Dustin initially reported lost wages to me. He advised that he missed 8 hours per day on 3/10 & 3/11, and he makes $25 per hour. I can get that payment processed. Do you know if he missed additional time?
I received a pip app from Jessica prior to her representation, which is attached. It looks like her hourly wage would be $17.50 per hour, but she reported returning to work on 3/17. Her off work note lists 3/27 as the return date. Can you please respond to the questions below?
-Where does Jessica work? What is her job title?
-Please provide a good contact for her supervisor. I need to send a wage verification form to them for dates missed beyond the first week (3/15).
-Is $17.50 an accurate hourly wage for her?
-Was she out of work the full time from 3/9-3/27?
-I also need to get a little more information included on the off-work note. We don't have medical records prior to 3/20. Can we get a note with a start and end date, and a little more info included as why she had to remain out for that amount of time?
As long as that hourly wage for her, I can get that first week paid while we wait for the wage verification form and off work note to come in.
Please let me know if you have any questions.
Katie Mills|KY Medical Claims Representative PO Box 2930 | Clinton, IA 52733 Phone 502-909-3687 | Fax 877-213-7258
